notes:
---

# *Patience sharpens the hidden edge*
*The path of the warrior is patience, not haste. Strike only when the moment is yours.*

---

Just don't **die**

---

 # *Strength blooms as shadows siphon*
 *Each strike echoes the Yōkai’s fang, mended by petals.*

 ---

The combination of  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) +  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) +  [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) is absurdly strong. 

- *WARNING : Do not buy [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) if you can't pair it with  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) . Check the **Item Guide** below for more details.*


Use your quick melee **as much as possible**.

If you have extra cash, go for tankiness :  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) and [Winning Attitude](item_8714087c-c078-4619-a2ef-327bc6edaa69) are the best options.

## Quick math: why melee is actually busted

- Quick melee base damage : 40
-  [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) : 15
-  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) : +15%

The formula is *(Base Quick Melee * WP * Melee Damage) + (Hidden Blade * WP)*

So this round, each Quick Melee deals :
- (40 * 1 * 1.15) + (15 * 1) = **61**

And you lifesteal 60% of Melee damage from  [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) + 25 from [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) + 5% of max health (over 2 seconds) from  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) .
Assuming you have 350 HP, each Quick Melee heals you :
- 61 * 0.6 + 25 + 350 * 0.05 = **79**

So basically every Quick Melee hits is a Kiriko kunai in damage and a Lifeweaver full blossom in healing.

---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 9k

Keep your round 1 items, and for every 1.5k you have, buy is this priority : [Winning Attitude](item_8714087c-c078-4619-a2ef-327bc6edaa69)   [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da)   [Adrenaline Shot](item_ab8eba6a-0bda-4b12-8854-4ba4169b515f) . 
Complete with [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) if you can.

## If you have less than 11.5k

[Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) +  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) +  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7).

This combo achieves similar stats as [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) while significantly boosting your shuriken damage. In this setup, you should try to play a bit less aggressively and focus more on poking. This actually aligns well with the situation : if you’re behind in economy, it usually means the enemy composition makes it harder to engage aggressively anyway.  [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) ,  [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93) and  [Cushioned Padding](item_20f2f4bc-4611-4d1f-b653-20f04d56b96f) instead of  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) are also worth considering depending on the situation.

## If you have more than 11.5k

For every extra 1.5k you have beyond the recommended build, get a green item with this priority :  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6)   [Winning Attitude](item_8714087c-c078-4619-a2ef-327bc6edaa69)   [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da)   [Adrenaline Shot](item_ab8eba6a-0bda-4b12-8854-4ba4169b515f) . 
Complete with  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) if you can.

 [Cushioned Padding](item_20f2f4bc-4611-4d1f-b653-20f04d56b96f) is also a good option in some situations, so keep that in mind.

## If you have more than 20k

Do NOT go for [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) . Simply add [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) or [Icy Coolant](item_8b1c21e9-33e8-49a6-8277-a3a06d55a65f) to the build, and then apply the same logic as above: prioritize green items in order and complete with  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) .

round_upgrades.notes: If you don't have enough for Gloomgauntlet, and you die a lot
If you don't have enough for Gloomgauntlet, and they have 3 beams
If you don't have enough for Gloomgauntlet (Check the guide)
Can be a good option if you’re struggling against enemy CC or DoTs (Ana, Junker Queen, Sigma, Cassidy, Ashe).

notes:
---

# *The blade awakens*
*When defense falters, the phantom’s strike claims its due.*

---

## You are not the main character yet. 
**But you are a deadly self-reliant assassin.**

Keep the same disciplined playstyle, but now, thanks to the insane lifesteal from  [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) with [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) , you can take riskier duels and pressure the tank.

You also want to use [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) in chokepoints during early fights to benefit from the AoE damage and help take space.

If you have extra cash, make sure to prioritize green items.


---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 21.5k : 

Prioritize [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) in most of cases. Complete your build with green survivability items as in the previous round, since being behind in cash likely means you are dying a lot and need extra sustain. Add [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) if you can.

The only scenario where you want to keep the [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) + [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) combo over [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) is when the enemy tank is a [Zarya](hero_be6cc516-0b7a-4515-8472-f489f08993b0) or a [Orisa](hero_91644d44-1093-4f62-ac51-020975465e85), and/or when the map is very open. In that case, get [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) + [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) + [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) , and complete with green items.

Green items are in this order of priority : [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6)  [Winning Attitude](item_8714087c-c078-4619-a2ef-327bc6edaa69)   [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) , and complete with [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418) and/or [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) .

## If you have more than 21.5k :

Complete the build with [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6), [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) and either [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418) or [Winning Attitude](item_8714087c-c078-4619-a2ef-327bc6edaa69). Consider sneaking in [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) instead of one of these if you can.


## If you have more than 30k :

That mean you don't really need more sustain, so go for more damage. Try to build arround [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) as it's the best item you can get for maximum damage for cheap. Complete with WP items if you can poke a lot, AP otherwise.

If you are super rich (more than 33k), go for [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) .   

_No matter how much money you have, don’t forget to consider  [Cushioned Padding](item_20f2f4bc-4611-4d1f-b653-20f04d56b96f) or  [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93) if the enemy comp makes them valuable._

---

# *Endurance and precision meld as one*
*Strength forged in patience readies the warrior’s final step.*

---

[Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) is super cool : not only does it give you +10% WP and +25% AP at full stacks (a total of +35% bonus damage on Dragonblade!), but it also grants you 25 HP. It's not much, but it's honest work.


---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 31.5k : 

Simply follow the item guide from the previous round.

## If you have more than 31.5k :

Try to add **two** of these items to the build, prioritizing the most expensive ones you can afford : [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) , [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418) , [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) , [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) , [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) , [Icy Coolant](item_8b1c21e9-33e8-49a6-8277-a3a06d55a65f) , [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) , [Nano Cola](item_79b22609-8046-4a8a-a5a2-bb49cd7e11c6).


Feel free to sell [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7)  if it lets you build a more cost-efficient setup that better maximizes your budget.

## If you have more than 42k :

Go for [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) and start building AP.

---

# *The mask is lifted*
*The silent bane claims the spotlight.*

---

## It's time.

Now you're ready to destroy the lobby 1v5.

We say goodbye to our beloved [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) and  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) , because now we want as much AP as possible. Say hello to [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) and  [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) .

Why ?

Because now you can perform the one-shot combo:
- 1) Get 5 [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) stacks
- 2) Deflect into [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168)
- 3) Right-click + Swift Strike
- 4) Right-click + Quick Melee

For a faster combo, **use Swift Strike as soon as Dragonblade hits at step 3**. It reduces damage, but is 100% worth it to avoid getting interrupted.


---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 40.5k :

Sell [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b), and add **three** of these items to the build instead, prioritizing the most expensive ones you can afford : [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418) , [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) , [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) , [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) , [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) , [Nano Cola](item_79b22609-8046-4a8a-a5a2-bb49cd7e11c6) .

## If you have more than 40.5k :

Add **two** of the items above.

## If you have more than 52k :

[Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) , or [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) if they have beams and/or you have low healing.

round_upgrades.notes: You don’t realize how much damage this does to tanks

notes:
---

# *The map is your dojo*
*Strike with fluid grace. Deflect, dash, dominate without pause.*

---

[Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) is the best choice here. 

- *[Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) counts as an ability, so each time you deflect, you get +10% WP.*

However, if you need more survivability (for example, you're on an open map against hitscans, or simply facing a Zarya) then [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) is better.


---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 51.5k :

Simply follow the item guide from the previous round.

## If you have more than 51.5k :

Add **any** good item that will help. 

If you seek **maximum damage**, [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) is the best choice, followed by [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) , [Nano Cola](item_79b22609-8046-4a8a-a5a2-bb49cd7e11c6) , [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) , and then [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418).

[Geneticist's Vial](item_c7443757-9e2a-4be8-b3a3-469ab64b0e9d) or [Overdrive Core](item_a2a8dba1-5f2f-4da1-9445-b08f49162121) can be good choices on Control or Clash maps. If you go this way, play ultra aggressively : the first fight is decisive on these maps.

---

# *You are the blade’s final truth*
*Unseen. Unstoppable. Unforgiving.*

---

Here’s what I consider the ultimate final build, with [Wyrm’s Maw](item_5d8c3488-13a9-432a-987e-275522f68cc4) to obliterate any target. Since you throw 5 shurikens after a [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) , the [Wyrm’s Maw](item_5d8c3488-13a9-432a-987e-275522f68cc4) effect instantly maxes out, giving you a 50% damage boost for free on your Swift Strike.

For reference, a dash will then deal 
- (50 * (1.65 + 0.25)) * 1.5 = **142.5 damage**


I also included an alternative Dragonblade endgame build with [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d) for those who feel a little different. [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee) is okay, but [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) is better if you have the money.

[Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) is also a very good option if you don't want to land shurikens before dashing, and/or need more sustain.

[Laceration](item_ee831ad3-3921-4aca-a761-c6b93cc7e7fe) is fine, but you get way more burst damage with  [Wyrm’s Maw](item_5d8c3488-13a9-432a-987e-275522f68cc4). Take it if the last map is very close and the enemy team is playing grouped.

---
# Detailed Item Guide

## If you have less than 65.5k : 

Simply follow the item guide from the previous round.

## If you have more than 65.5k : 

There is nothing more you can do !

---
## That's it ! Enjoy your games ;)
